title: Spleen Tackles ASCII Art
content:
[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/jdraw/drawings/ascii/dragon-final.txt]Observe[/url]

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/jdraw/drawings/ascii/foregrounddragon.txt]An early sketch[/url]

If you have JavE, you can watch the 'making-of' video and see how the drawing evolved.
[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/jdraw/drawings/ascii/dragon-final.jmov.zip]ZIP[/url] 175kb
[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/jdraw/drawings/ascii/dragon-final.jmov.rar]RAR[/url] 107kb

If you don't have JavE, you can get it [url=http://www.jave.de/download/download.html]here[/url]. You'll need the annoying Jave Runtime Environment installed to use it, though. I'm currently looking for a more convenient utility.

title: Re: Spleen Tackles ASCII Art
content:
Nice. I had a little trouble making out the early sketch until I new what it was though.________________

title: Re: Spleen Tackles ASCII Art
content:
These are pretty good! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Spleen Tackles ASCII Art
content:
How long did it take you to make that? Nice work, and happy birthday. -----------------
[img]http://www.lot123.com.au/i/banner01.gif[/img]

title: ASCII!
content:
The basic structure of the dragon was ready on the 19th (the first frame of the movie), but most of it was done in a five or six hour sitting from Friday night (21st) until a minute prior to quarter past three on the 22nd.

If you include the awful-looking sketches I scratched up to teach myself how to draw dragons before I started ASCIIing it, then we're looking at about five days to a week.

title: Re: ASCII!
content:
Just because it has a dragon in it, means I love it.

Good job. More like awesome job actually. I hope she liked it. You put a lot of time and effort into this and it shows. I always like to see ASCII art... it is such a... lame media (like how crayons are a lame media) and people do such awesome things with it.

Um... why did you include our names at the bottom? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

Anyways still totally awesome.
[img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/Keen-thumbs-up.gif[/img]-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://img360.imageshack.us/img360/548/blegdandsmeegnewbanner2wf.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: ASCII!
content:
"Um... why did you include our names at the bottom?"
Obviously because.. Eh.. I don't know. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] Happy birthday Tess! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Der Greetz.
content:
[hr]Gal Um... why did you include our names at the bottom?
[hr]Because you happened to be on MSN at the time and gave me feedback on the previews I offered you. What kind of oldeschool prod would it be without greets?

title: Re: Der Greetz.
content:
1337ness. An interesting piece of art in a medium I cannot utilize on account of you have to have it all roughly planned out first.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
